archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Fire-Grilled Picanha with Habanero Chimichurri, Korean-Style Cucumber Quick Pickle, and Brown Basmati Rice
description: Char-grilled picanha in a hot chilli-garlic glaze, served with tangy cucumber quick pickles and brown basmati rice, finished with a fiery chimichurri. Advanced, from-scratch build with bold Korean and Latin American heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups brown basmati rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
Thinly slice 1 cucumber into half-moons; slice 2 spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of chilli flakes for the quick pickle.
In a small bowl, mix 1/3 cup chimichurri with 1–2 tbsp habanero sauce and the juice of 1/2 lime; adjust salt to taste.
In another bowl, make a glaze: 1 tbsp chilli paste, 2 grated garlic cloves, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp brown sugar, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Pat dry 1–1.2 kg picanha steak; score fat cap lightly and coat with the chilli-garlic glaze.
Chop 2 tbsp coriander and 2 tbsp parsley for garnish.
Preheat outdoor grill to high (two zones if possible: hot and medium).
cook_steps: Combine rinsed rice with 3 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt in a pot; bring to a boil on the stovetop, then cover and simmer on low until tender, 25–30 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes.
Toss cucumber slices in the pickle brine; set aside, stirring once or twice while you cook.
Oil grill grates lightly with a paper towel dipped in olive oil. Place picanha fat-side down over medium heat zone to render for 6–8 minutes, managing flare-ups.

Move to hot zone and sear 2–3 minutes per side for a deep char. Continue grilling over medium heat until internal temp reaches your preference (about 50–54°C for medium-rare), 10–15 minutes total depending on thickness.
Rest steak on a board 8–10 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
Fluff rice with a fork. Drain excess liquid from the cucumber pickles.
Plate: spoon rice, fan sliced picanha, add cucumber quick pickles, and drizzle the habanero chimichurri over the steak.
Garnish with spring onion, coriander, and parsley. Serve extra habanero chimichurri on the side.
